case_vignette: A 44-year-old man comes to the physician because of fatigue and increased straining during defecation for 3 months. During this time, he has lost 5 kg (12 lb) despite no change in appetite. He has a family history of colon cancer in his maternal uncle and maternal grandfather. His mother died of ovarian cancer at the age of 46. Physical examination shows conjunctival pallor. His hemoglobin concentration is 11.2 g/dL, hematocrit is 34%, and mean corpuscular volume is 76 μm3. Colonoscopy shows an exophytic mass in the ascending colon. Pathologic examination of the resected mass shows a poorly differentiated adenocarcinoma. Genetic analysis shows a mutation in the MSH2 gene.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Hematology and Oncology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been feeling really tired and it's been harder for me to go to the bathroom, like I have to strain more to poop, and this has been going on for about 3 months.
How old are you?
I'm 44 years old.
Do you have any history of colon cancer in your family?
Yes, my maternal uncle and my grandfather had colon cancer, and my mother died of ovarian cancer when she was 46.
Have you noticed any blood in your stool?
No, I haven't noticed any blood in my stool.
Have you lost any weight recently without trying?
Yes, I've lost 5 kg (12 lb) without trying to.
Have you experienced any changes in your appetite?
No, my appetite hasn't changed.
Have you experienced any abdominal pain or discomfort?
The vignette doesn't mention abdominal pain or discomfort, so I can't say I have.
**Final Diagnosis:** Familial adenomatous polyposis (FAP)
